headline: Brazil brings forward disassembled electric vehicles import tax hike
summary: Fully or partially disassembled vehicles, known as CKDs and SKDs, will be subject to a 35% import tax from January 2027, and no longer in July 2028, Gecex-Camex said.  On the other hand, Gecex-Camex approved an additional free-tariff quota, worthing $463 million for CKD and SKD imports, valid for six months.

raw.headline: Brazil brings forward disassembled electric vehicles import tax hike
raw.summary: Fully or partially disassembled vehicles, known as CKDs and SKDs, will be subject to a 35% import tax from January 2027, and no longer in July 2028, Gecex-Camex said.  On the other hand, Gecex-Camex approved an additional free-tariff quota, worthing $463 million for CKD and SKD imports, valid for six months.

headline: Ford Earnings Beat Estimates. The Quarter Was Still a Mess.
summary: Ford reported second-quarter operating profit of $2.1 billion, better than the $1.9 billion Wall Street expected. Ford’s adjusted number, however, didn’t include $1.3 billion in special charges.

raw.headline: Ford Earnings Beat Estimates. The Quarter Was Still a Mess.

headline: Ford reports Q2 earnings beat but takes $800M tariff hit
summary: Ford posted an earnings and revenue beat for the second quarter and reinstated full-year guidance, but upped its full-year tariff exposure after seeing $800 million in tariff costs in Q2 alone.

raw.headline: Ford reports Q2 earnings beat but takes $800M tariff hit
raw.summary: Ford posted an earnings and revenue beat for the second quarter and reinstated full-year guidance, but upped its full-year tariff exposure after seeing $800 million in tariff costs in Q2 alone.

headline: Ford Motor (F) Appoints Alicia Boler Davis As President Of Ford Pro
summary: Ford Motor (F) recently announced an executive leadership transition, with Alicia Boler Davis set to lead Ford Pro beginning October 1, 2025. Her extensive background at Alto Pharmacy, Amazon, and General Motors could strengthen Ford's strategic direction, contributing to its recent 10.7% share price increase over the last quarter. Despite this change, broader market trends such as optimism around corporate earnings, including major tech company results, and stable interest rates, suggest...

headline: If Tariffs Are That Great, 'Why Are Trump And Josh Hawley Now Pushing Rebate Checks?' Fox News Host Asks
summary: Co-host of Fox News’ “The Five” Jessica Tarlov took aim at President Donald Trump and Sen. Josh Hawley (R-MO) this week over their push for rebate checks funded by tariff revenue. Tarlov argued the move highlights how tariffs are hurting American consumers, not foreign competitors. Tariffs Are ‘Taxes On Americans,’ Tarlov Says “Trump has been creating these trade wars that have resulted in Americans paying more for goods,” Tarlov posted on X on Monday. “Tariffs are taxes on Americans — consumers

headline: Alicia Boler Davis, Veteran Leader in Autos, Tech, Logistics and Customer Experience, Named President of Ford Pro
summary: DEARBORN, Mich., July 30, 2025--Ford Motor Company announced today that Alicia Boler Davis, an accomplished executive with more than 30 years of experience in automotive, technology, and customer experience, has been named president of Ford Pro, effective Oct. 1. She succeeds Andrew Frick, who has served as interim leader of Ford Pro since last year and will continue to lead Ford Blue and Ford Model e.

headline: Porsche and Mercedes Squeezed by U.S. Tariffs and Chinese Slump
summary: Porsche and Mercedes-Benz reported dramatic declines in profit Wednesday, hit by President Trump’s tariffs on one side of the world and a collapse in Chinese luxury sales on the other.  It is “a kind of sandwich situation,” said Porsche Chief Executive Officer Oliver Blume.  Porsche, which imports all the vehicles it sells in the U.S. from Europe, said new tariffs cost it €400 million in the first half, equivalent to around $465 million.

raw.headline: Porsche and Mercedes Squeezed by U.S. Tariffs and Chinese Slump
raw.summary: Porsche and Mercedes-Benz reported dramatic declines in profit Wednesday, hit by President Trump’s tariffs on one side of the world and a collapse in Chinese luxury sales on the other.  It is “a kind of sandwich situation,” said Porsche Chief Executive Officer Oliver Blume.  Porsche, which imports all the vehicles it sells in the U.S. from Europe, said new tariffs cost it €400 million in the first half, equivalent to around $465 million.

headline: Ford Earnings Are Coming. Brace For a Messy Miss.
summary: Ford reports second-quarter earnings on Wednesday. Wall Street is looking for an operating profit of $1.9 billion and earnings per share of 33 cents from sales of $45.8 billion.

raw.headline: Ford Earnings Are Coming. Brace For a Messy Miss.
raw.summary: Ford reports second-quarter earnings on Wednesday. Wall Street is looking for an operating profit of $1.9 billion and earnings per share of 33 cents from sales of $45.8 billion.

headline: Porsche, Aston Martin hike US prices as hopes for tariff sweeteners fade
summary: BERLIN (Reuters) -European luxury carmakers including Porsche and Aston Martin have surged ahead with U.S. price hikes, which could point the way for bigger brands to follow in their wake as companies pass on the cost of tariffs.  The United States and Europe reached a trade deal that will see EU-made cars hit with a 15% tariff from August, lower than once threatened but far higher than the 2.5% rate before U.S. President Donald Trump launched his trade offensive this year.  On Wednesday, Volkswagen's luxury brand Porsche said it had raised U.S. prices by between 2.3% and 3.6% in July, with no plans for now to establish a U.S. production presence - a move that would let it avoid the levies.

headline: Exclusive-Tesla signs $4.3 billion LGES battery deal, source says, reducing China reliance
summary: SEOUL (Reuters) -South Korea's LG Energy Solution (LGES) has signed a $4.3 billion deal to supply Tesla with energy storage system batteries, said a person familiar with the matter, as the U.S. company looks to reduce reliance on Chinese imports due to tariffs.  The lithium iron phosphate (LFP) batteries will be supplied from LGES's U.S. factory in Michigan, the person said on condition of anonymity because the details were not public.  LGES announced earlier on Wednesday that it had signed a $4.3 billion contract to supply LFP batteries over three years globally, without identifying the customer or saying if they would be used in vehicles or energy storage systems.

raw.headline: Exclusive-Tesla signs $4.3 billion LGES battery deal, source says, reducing China reliance
raw.summary: SEOUL (Reuters) -South Korea's LG Energy Solution (LGES) has signed a $4.3 billion deal to supply Tesla with energy storage system batteries, said a person familiar with the matter, as the U.S. company looks to reduce reliance on Chinese imports due to tariffs.  The lithium iron phosphate (LFP) batteries will be supplied from LGES's U.S. factory in Michigan, the person said on condition of anonymity because the details were not public.  LGES announced earlier on Wednesday that it had signed a $4.3 billion contract to supply LFP batteries over three years globally, without identifying the customer or saying if they would be used in vehicles or energy storage systems.

headline: LG Energy Solution signs $4.3 billion battery supply contract
summary: South Korean battery maker LG Energy Solution (LGES) said on Wednesday it had signed a $4.3 billion contract to supply lithium iron phosphate (LFP) batteries over three years globally, without identifying the customer. The company, whose major customers include Tesla and General Motors, did not say whether the LFP batteries will be used in vehicles or energy storage systems. The contract lasts from August 2027 to July 2030.

The company, whose major customers include Tesla and General Motors, did not say whether the LFP batteries will be used in vehicles or energy storage systems. The contract lasts from August 2027 to July 2030.
